rename.from: PDF attachment contents missing in Emails on CI 3.1.0
rename.to: PDF attachment contents missing in Outlook Emails on CI 3.1.0

body:
Ok, there's two things I see at first glance ...
1. You're comparing 3.0.4 to 3.1.0, which means you're skipping 2 versions in between - 3.0.5 and 3.0.6. Please verify the exact "point of failure".
2. There _are_ changes related to attachments in 3.1.0 (see #4583), but they don't relate to the Subject encoding. In fact - there are _zero_ changes affecting this between 3.0.4 and 3.1.0, which leads me to believe you're also doing something else different (maybe a different environment? idk)

Either way, we do need more details.
Had the same problem couple of weeks back with email attachments not working... switched to phpmailer...

> Had the same problem couple of weeks back with email attachments not working... switched to phpmailer...

Thank you, that is very helpful.
will do some testing later today... :-)

Good morning!

Having downloaded & tested 3.0.5 - there's no problem. Attachment appears should, at 257 _Kilobytes_ with the contents intact & un-corrupted. Made a couple of changes to the code at thread start to make sure the `filesize` is of a suspected size & `$mail->attach()` is separated into it's on `if()` statement, just to make sure it's not failing. 

Secondly, I realised it wasn't very helpful publishing the headers; as it's the boundaries of the multi-part data that's the important thing here, which there's been subtle changes between `3.0.5` & `3.1.0`. (Should there be a newline after `Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64` on `3.1.0`?). The charset is cased differently, however I do specify that at the email config. 

As for the Email Client, I'm using **Outlook 2010** & **Outlook.com Webmail** which both had the same issue. 

I have tested this with my gmail and it is correctly showing the PDF intriguingly. So could just be an Edge case.

@MackieeE Thanks for the further input, I'll try to see if I there's any clue in there.

However, please don't edit your original (and already long enough message) - it makes my replies senseless and the conversation hard to follow.

@narfbg Quite right; I'll put any further input as a new comment for future references. I can understand a year from now it may look like a complete jumbled conversation :)

This is all being tested with PHP 7.0.8 mind you; If there's anything else you'd like me to change or test. Please let me know!

Indeed, a second newline characters is missing and I'm quite sure that's not intentional.

Is that the problem for sure?

That seems to be it. Since adding an intentional extra `$this->newline`, it's worked perfectly.  

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/883702/17291623/06fd6146-57dd-11e6-81ae-6f9a82272620.png)

I'm running the server on **_Ubuntu 14.04.01**_ and this has also been tested on **_Redhat 4.4**_ as well. Both producing the same result a missing newline at: [`_append_attachments`](https://github.com/bcit-ci/CodeIgniter/blob/develop/system/libraries/Email.php#L1467)

However it _should_ add a newline regardless before & after `(empty($this->_attachments[$i]['cid'])` but this isn't showing at the debug. I'm guessing the OS in question isn't treating the `\n` correctly.

It doesn't matter what you test it on server-side, that code is platform-independent.

Anyway, the referenced commit should fix it.

issue.title: Error with "non-inline" email attachments

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
Version 3.1.0

There is an issue which occurs in `/system/libraries/Email.php` on line `1471` when you add attachments to an email and none of them have a `Content-ID`.

When there is a Content-ID specified the resulting message looks something like this:

```
Content-Type: image/jpeg; name="test.jpg"
Content-Disposition: inline;
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-ID: <test.jpg@57a0a6e46acfc>

/9j/4AAQSkZJRgABAQEBLAEsAAD/4QCqRXhpZgAATU0AKgAAAAgACQEaAAUAAAABAAAAegEbAAUA
AAABAAAAggEoAAMAAAABAAMAAAExAAIAAAAQAAAAigMBAAUAAAABAAAAmgMDAAEAAAABAAAAAFEQ
AAEAAAABAQAAAFERAAQAAAABAAAuIlESAAQAAAABAAAuIgAAAAAAAczvAAAD6AABzO8AAAPocGFp
```

However, when there us no Content-ID specified (i.e. not an inline attachment) then the message looks something like this:

```
Content-Type: image/jpeg; name="test.jpg"
Content-Disposition: attachment;
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
/9j/4AAQSkZJRgABAQEBLAEsAAD/4QCqRXhpZgAATU0AKgAAAAgACQEaAAUAAAABAAAAegEbAAUA
AAABAAAAggEoAAMAAAABAAMAAAExAAIAAAAQAAAAigMBAAUAAAABAAAAmgMDAAEAAAABAAAAAFEQ
AAEAAAABAQAAAFERAAQAAAABAAAuIlESAAQAAAABAAAuIgAAAAAAAczvAAAD6AABzO8AAAPocGFp

```

Take note that now there is no blank line between the attachment headers and content.

Because the blank line is missing the email seems to appear corrupted when read - I do not know why this happens. I have tested with IIS SMTP Server and MS Exchange Servers 2010 and 2013.

Simply adding in the blank line seems to fix the issue so I changed line `1471` from

`.(empty($this->_attachments[$i]['cid']) ? '' : 'Content-ID: <'.$this->_attachments[$i]['cid'].'>'.$this->newline.$this->newline)`

to

`.(empty($this->_attachments[$i]['cid']) ? '' : 'Content-ID: <'.$this->_attachments[$i]['cid'].'>'.$this->newline).$this->newline`

I hope this helps someone.

issue.title: 3.1.0 Email Library Corrupting PDF Attachments

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
When attaching MPDF generated PDF's to an email in 3.1.0 the header for the pdf file itself is modified and the beginning of the file is truncated.

I am attaching a screenshot to show what I mean.

Reverting only the email library file back to 3.0.6 in the system folder resolves the issue.

Version 3.0.6 - Expected Output
![3 0 6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2049188/17409184/1750985e-5a3c-11e6-8c5f-c61fa412cf7b.PNG)

Version 3.1.0 - Invalid file format
![3 1 0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2049188/17409192/22f95b14-5a3c-11e6-94d2-586ec7f0a912.PNG)

issue.title: email attachment not downloadable

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
Hi!

Using CI 3.1.0 I've noticed the attachment is not downloadable. It appears in an email client software, but there is a missing filesize and it is not possible to open it. After examining the message code, I've noticed the difference from other messages with working attachments, and that was a missing newline between the attachment headers and base64 content. As soon as I added a newline character to Email system library, attachment started to working correctly, so please examine this, and apply a patch where appropriate.

The issue with a solution is available here as well
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25416585/codeigniter-send-email-with-attach-file

Temporary fix (or maybe a final as well?) is the following. At line 725 of Email, function _attach()_, there should be a "\r\n" newline character, as displayed below:

``` php
# system/libraries/Email.php, line 725
'content'   => "\r\n" . chunk_split(base64_encode($file_content)),
```

Best!

body:
Adding extra "$this->newline" works for me.
Was:
. 'Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64' . $this->newline
Is:
. 'Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64' . $this->newline. $this->newline
@skycyclone @vhuerta We speak English. Not a clue what you are trying to say, and your comments are not helpful!
